revised_title: Improved Theory for Determining Changes in Satellite Orbits
tldr: The authors develop a new theory for determining changes in satellite orbits caused by meridional winds in the upper atmosphere. They show that using the parameter θ, where θ is the latitude, leads to a simpler and more accurate theory for expressing changes in orbital inclination and right ascension of an orbit of any eccentricity. The theory is developed for both high and low eccentricity orbits and can be used to improve the accuracy of satellite navigation.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
